newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah little changed in late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah little changed in late trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was little changed against the dollar in late trading on Monday on the back of sufficient liquidity, dealers said.
Dealers said liquidity was mostly sufficient despite earlier expectations that it would be tight due to month-end factors and half-year book closing.
Spot rupiah was at 2,431.60/31.75 at 0845 GMT against an opening of 2,430.50/31.50.
Tomorrow and today rupiah were last at 2,431.50/31.65 and 2,430.75/31.25, respectively.
Dealers said the spot rupiah rate was likely to range between 2,431.00 to 2,432.50 on Tuesday.
One European bank dealer said trading in the spot market was seen continuing to move in a tight range, while long-term swaps were under pressure on sustained rupiah liquidity.
"Long-term swaps continued to come under pressure as some overseas operators were further squeezed due to sustained rupiah liquidity in the money market," one European bank dealer said.
One-month swaps fell to 12.75/14.25 from an opening of 14.00/15.00, two fell to 26.00/27.00 from 27.50/28.50, three to 39.75/41.00 and six to 81.00/83.00 from 84.00/86.00 points.
Overnight swap was last at 0.20/0.25 while tom/next was at 0.13/0.15 points.
The central bank, Bank Indonesia, raised its intervention band by one point to 2,426/2,618 and its conversion band also by one point to 2,426/2,474 late on Monday.
